message.content:
cs.AR, cs.DB, cs.OS, cs.SY, cs.DC

This paper discusses the use of storage-class memory (SCM) and flash memory technology, which are commonly studied in computer architecture (cs.AR) and operating systems (cs.OS) research. The paper also proposes a novel mechanism for extending the lifetime of flash-based SCM, which involves changes to the flash management software (FTL), which is a topic of interest in systems research (cs.SY). Additionally, the paper discusses the quantification of data longevity in SCM, which is relevant to database (cs.DB) research. Finally, the paper uses simulation-based analysis to evaluate the proposed mechanism, which is a common approach in distributed computing (cs.DC) research.
